titleStmt.title: A sermon of the blessed sacrament of the Lords Supper; proving that there is therein no proper sacrifice now offered; together with the disapproving of sundry passages in 2. bookes set forth by Dr. Pocklington; the one called Altare Christianum, the other Sunday no Sabbath: formerly printed with licence. By William Bray, Dr. of Divinity. Now published by command.
titleStmt.author: Bray, William, d. 1644.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T. and R.C. for Henry Seile, and are to be sold at his shop in Fleetstreete, over against St. Dunstans-Church,

notesStmt.note: A recantation sermon which the Long Parliament ordered Bray to preach after he had licensed Pocklington's two works. Pocklington's views were extremely high-church.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Fleetstreete, over against St. Dunstans-Church
